title: Thai Green Curry
summary: The recipe Thai Green Curry could satisfy your Indian craving in approximately 45 minutes. Watching your figure? This gluten free and vegan recipe has 287 calories, 11g of protein, and 21g of fat per serving. For $1.81 per serving, this recipe covers 17% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 3. Head to the store and pick up zucchini, extra tofu, brown sugar, and a few other things to make it today. 1 person found this recipe to be tasty and satisfying. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 73%. This score is solid. Try Homemade Thai Green Curry Paste (And An Easy Thai Green Curry), Thai Green Curry Turkey and Zucchini Meatloaf in a Coconut Milk Green Curry Sauce, and Thai Veg Green Curry , How to make Thai Veg Green Curry for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Gruener Veltliner, Riesling, and Sparkling rosé are great choices for Indian. The best wine for Indian food will depending on the dish, of course, but these picks can be served chilled and have some sweetness to complement the spiciness and complex flavors of a wide variety of traditional dishes. One wine you could try is Brundlmayer Kamptaler Terrassen Gruner Veltliner. It has 4.3 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 25 dollars.

productMatches.title: Brundlmayer Kamptaler Terrassen Gruner Veltliner
productMatches.description: Flowery, delicate lime fruit, apple and pine apple with a hint of herbs, spice and yeast, soft at first taste, despite its lively acidity, then straightforward, fresh on the palate, sappy fruit, mineral nuances, good structure and balance, medium body and fine minerals in the spicy finish.A perfect companion to many starters such as smoked trout, ham, cold vegetables, tapas, or fresh marinated goat cheese with herbs; also very good with fish barbecue, sea food, or roasted chicken.

instructions: Meanwhile, pour about 1/3 of the coconut milk into a small saucepan and heat just until hot. Stir in the curry paste and, using a spoon, mash it into the coconut milk. Once it is combined well, add it to the vegetables and tofu, stir well, then add the rest of the coconut milk to the pot. Add the brown sugar, the bok choy stems, and the soy sauce. Stir everything together, lower the heat, and allow to cook until the flavors are well blended, about 15 minutes. A few minutes before serving, stir in the cilantro and the bok choy leaves. Allow to wilt slightly. Serve over jasmine rice.

steps.step: Meanwhile, pour about 1/3 of the coconut milk into a small saucepan and heat just until hot. Stir in the curry paste and, using a spoon, mash it into the coconut milk. Once it is combined well, add it to the vegetables and tofu, stir well, then add the rest of the coconut milk to the pot.

Add the brown sugar, the bok choy stems, and the soy sauce. Stir everything together, lower the heat, and allow to cook until the flavors are well blended, about 15 minutes. A few minutes before serving, stir in the cilantro and the bok choy leaves. Allow to wilt slightly.
